qas.question: In what year was the Imperial Tientsin University founded in China?
What was the first university to offer courses in liberal arts?
What portion of China's elite universities still have a primary polytechnical focus today?

context: China's modern higher education began in <a0_0>1895<a0_0/> with the Imperial Tientsin University which was a polytechnic plus a law department. Liberal arts were not offered until three years later at <a1_0>Capital University<a1_0/>. To this day, about <a2_0>half<a2_0/> of China's elite universities remain essentially polytechnical.
